note.p: Education: Nelson College; University College, London. BScEng

Career: Served with the British Army in France (for 3 years); worked for Armstrong Whitworth & Co, as Assistant Enginner, Mangahao hydro-electric scheme (1922-1924), then as Engineer in charge, Arapum Dam (1924-1927), both in New Zealand; worked on further dams in New Zealand (1928-1930); involved in Galloway hydro-electric scheme, Scotland (1931-1937); Resident Engineer, Woronora Dam, Sydney, Australia; Chief Construction Engineer and Engineer-in-chief, Metropolitan Water, Sewerage and Drainage Board, Sydney; Commissioner, Snowy Mountains Hydro-Electric Authority (1949); retired (1967); President, National Safety Council of Australia; Chairman, Road Safety Council, New South Wales
Obituaries: Biographical Memoirs of Fellows of the Royal Society 1979 vol 25 pp 319-335, plate, by Sir Angus Paton
References: Robin J H Clark and Michael J Kelly, 'New Zealand, New Zealanders and the Royal Society' in NR 1994 vol 48 pp 263-281
